dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6603 IH: No Technology for Terror Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Moran (for himself and Mr. McCaul) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To apply foreign-direct product rules to Iran.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Technology for Terror Act.

section.header: Application of foreign-direct product rules to Iran

subsection.text: Beginning on the date that is 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, a foreign-produced item shall be subject to the Export Administration Regulations (pursuant to the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 (50 U.S.C. 4801 et seq.)) if the item—

subparagraph.text: the product scope requirements described in subsection (b); and
the destination scope requirements described in subsection (c); and

paragraph.text: is exported, reexported, or in-country transferred to Iran or involves persons affiliated with the Government of Iran.

subsection.text: A foreign-produced item meets the product scope requirements of this subsection if the item—

paragraph.text: is a direct product of United States-origin technology or software subject to the Export Administration Regulations that is specified in a covered Export Control Classification Number; or

is produced by any plant or major component of a plant that is located outside the United States, if the plant or major component of a plant, whether made in the United States or a foreign country, itself is a direct product of United States-origin technology or software subject to the Export Administration Regulations that is specified in a covered Export Control Classification Number.

subsection.text: A foreign-produced item meets the destination scope requirements of this subsection if there is knowledge that the foreign-produced item is destined to Iran or will be incorporated into or used in the production or development of any part, component, or equipment subject to the Export Administration Regulations and produced in or destined to Iran.

paragraph.text: A license shall be required to export, reexport, or in-country transfer a foreign-produced item that meets the product scope requirements described in subsection (b) and the destination scope requirements described in subsection (c) and is subject to the Export Administration Regulations pursuant to this section.
The license requirements of paragraph (1) shall not apply to—

clause.text: not designated under or listed on the Commerce Control List; or

subparagraph.text: services, software, or hardware (other than services, software, or hardware for end-users owned or controlled by the Government of Iran) that is—

subclause.text: Export Control Classification Number 5A992.c or 5D992.c, and classified in accordance with section 740.17 of title 15 Code of Federal Regulations; and

clause.text: subject to a general license issued by the Department of Commerce.

paragraph.text: the term Commerce Control List means the list maintained pursuant to part 744 of the Export Administration Regulations;
the term covered Export Control Classification Number means an Export Control Classification Number in product group D or E of Category 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, or 9 of the Commerce Control List;

the terms Export Administration Regulations, export, reexport, and in-country transfer have the meanings given those terms in section 1742 of the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 (50 U.S.C. 4801); and

the terms direct product, technology, software, major component, knowledge, production, development, part, component, equipment, and government end users have the meanings given those terms in section 734.9 or part 772 of the Export Administration Regulations, as the case may be.
